item.title: QQ Group Log of HaskellChina: 20170412
item.description: The Fool : 2017-04-12 20:40:34 æ‰€ä»¥Racketå¼•å…¥äº†æ–¹æ‹¬å·( : 2017-04-12 20:40:39 http://www.paulgraham.com/arcll1.html : 2017-04-12 20:40:57 McCarthy, who wanted to keep his axioms to a minimum, buried progn within cond. That worked for his examples, but for programming in general you soon find you need a progn separate from the implicit progn of cond. : 2017-04-12 20:41:18 Having an implicit progn in cond means every cond clause has to have an extra pair of parentheses.
